comments: The rightmost digit in the base-8 representation of n. Also, the equivalent value of the three rightmost digits in the base-2 representation of n. - _Hieronymus Fischer_, Jun 12 2007
links: Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients, signature (0,0,0,0,0,0,0,1).
formula: Complex representation: a(n)=(1/8)*(1-r^n)*sum{1<=k<8, k*product{1<=m<8,m<>k, (1-r^(n-m))}} where r=exp(pi/4*i)=(1+i)*sqrt(2)/2 and i=sqrt(-1).Trigonometric representation: a(n)=256*(sin(n*pi/8))^2*sum{1<=k<8, k*product{1<=m<8,m<>k, (sin((n-m)*pi/8))^2}}.G.f.: g(x)=(sum{1<=k<8, k*x^k})/(1-x^8).Also: g(x)=x(7x^8-8x^7+1)/((1-x^8)(1-x)^2). - _Hieronymus Fischer_, May 31 2007a(n)=n mod 2+2*(floor(n/2)mod 4)=A000035(n)+2*A010873(A004526(n)).a(n)=n mod 4+4*(floor(n/4)mod 2)=A010873(n)+4*A000035(A002265(n)).a(n)=n mod 2+2*(floor(n/2)mod 2)+4*(floor(n/4)mod 2)=A000035(n)+2*A000035(A004526(n)))+4*A000035(A002265(n)). - _Hieronymus Fischer_, Jun 12 2007a(n)=(1/2)*(7-(-1)^n-2*(-1)^(b/4)-4*(-1)^((b-2+2*(-1)^(b/4))/8)) where b=2n-1+(-1)^n. - _Hieronymus Fischer_, Jun 12 2007General formula for period 2^k: a(n)=(1/2)*(2^k-1-sum{0<=j<k, 2^j*(-1)^p(j,n)}) where p(j,n) is defined recursively by p(0,n)=n, p(j,n)=(1/4)*(2*p(j-1,n)-1+(-1)^p(j-1,n)). - _Hieronymus Fischer_, Jun 14 2007a(n) = floor(1234567/99999999*10^(n+1)) mod 10. - _Hieronymus Fischer_, Jan 03 2013a(n) = floor(48913/2396745*8^(n+1)) mod 8. - _Hieronymus Fischer_, Jan 04 2013
